title: Google Cast test cases
custom_preconds:
Background:
Google has provided a set of test cases to be executed to make the Cast experience consistent across all devices. 
test cases are available here: https://developers.google.com/cast/docs/testing

From Google: 
"Testing is currently manual. Test cases test all aspects of your Cast application: the sender, receiver, multi-sender scenario, playback, autoplay (when applicable), queueing (when applicable) and Android TV experience.

The test case priority is also specified, where P0 is the highest priority. Your application must not launch with a P0 bug."

Given a user has
- 2 Chromecast devices (for Android/iOS sender test cases)
- 1 Android TV (for ATV test cases)
- 1 iOS device with At Bat installed
- 1 Android device with At Bat installed
custom_steps:
Make a copy of the Google Cast test cases test cases can be found here: https://developers.google.com/cast/docs/testing
then execute all of the Android/iOS sender test cases
then execute all of the ATV test cases
custom_expected:
All P0 test cases/steps pass

Note: fill out the Bug Score Table that's part of the Google Cast test case document

title: Use Case: After casting a VOD
custom_preconds: Given a user is casting a VOD from At Bat
custom_steps: When the VOD is done casting on the external display
custom_expected:
Then the user will see MLB logo
and after a few seconds will transition to the first idle screen

title: User Case: After casting a MLB archived game
custom_preconds: Given a user is casting an archived game from At Bat
custom_steps: When the archived game is done casting on the external display
custom_expected:
Then the user will see MLB logo
and after a few seconds will transition to the first idle screen

title: Use Case: Starting new content when Idle screen
custom_preconds: Given a user has an idle screen on a Chromecast
custom_steps: When a user attempts to cast new content
custom_expected: Then the content will begin to cast, replacing the idle screen

title: Use Case: Idle Screen rotation
custom_preconds: Given a user is casting a VOD or an archived game from At Bat (only test with one video stream)
custom_steps: When the VOD/archived game is done casting on the external display
custom_expected:
Then the user will see MLB logo
and after a few seconds will transition to first idle screen
and after 30 seconds a new idle screen will appear

title: Use Case: Screen Order
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps: When the Chromecast is idle
custom_expected:
Then the user will see rotating idle screens in the following order/duration:
1. Today's Games/Scores for 30 seconds (this screen is not displayed off-season)
2. Standings for 30 seconds (this screen is displayed continuously off-season)

title: Use Case: Disconnect from Cast
custom_preconds:
Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
and the user has not cast media
custom_steps:
When a user sees the rotating idle screens (30 seconds each)
and the user has been idle for 5 minutes
custom_expected:
Then the user will be disconnected from the Chromecast
and the Chromecast will display the default Chromecast screen

title: Logos on Standings and Schedules
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and the user is on the Standings idle screen
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the correct logos for the teams

If it is NOT the off-season, repeat for the Schedules idle screen.

Team logos are here: http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/team-logos/html5/65x65/{teamId}.png 
where {teamId} is replaced with Team ID from this table: https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=25799264

title: Design
custom_preconds:
Given a user is connected to a Chromecast device
and a user is idle
custom_steps: When a user is on the Standings idle screen
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a configurable background image
and MLB logo in the upper left
and the title of the screen (STANDINGS)
and informative text (Ready to cast from your phone, laptop or tablet.)
and two tables (American League and National League)
with the divisional titles (East, Central, West) separating the two tables 

Team logos are here: http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/team-logos/html5/65x65/{teamId}.png
where {teamId} is replaced with Team ID from this table: https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=25799264

MLB logos are available via the 'MLB.tv logos' link here: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/QAspace/Test+Engineering+-+Devices

There are 6 background images that change with the idle screens every 30 seconds; the background images are located here:
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-01.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-02.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-03.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-04.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-05.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-06.jpg

title: Divisional Standings
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps: When a user is on the Standings idle screen
custom_expected:
Then the user will see updated Standings
and correct AL East teams
and correct AL Central teams
and correct AL West teams
and correct NL East teams
and correct NL Central teams
and correct NL West teams

Team/Division/Standings information should match http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/standings/

title: Clinch Indicator
custom_preconds:
Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
And one or more teams have clinched a playoff spot
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Standings idle screen
custom_expected:
IF the season has progressed enough for clinch data to be available
IF the season has progressed enough for clinch data to be known

Then the user will see the correct clinch data prefixed to teams

w- (clinched wild card)
x- (clinched playoff berth)
y- (clinched division)
z- (clinched division and best record in the league)

Compare Wild Card standings against the web: http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/standings/wildcard.jsp?ymd=20170627 (note: link takes you to today's Wild Card standings even though the date is in the past, but you can edit the ymd field to today's date OR go to https://www.mlb.com/standings and select the Wild Card view)

title: Wins
custom_preconds: Given the user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Standings idle screen
custom_expected:
Then the user will see updated Wins (W) for each club

Wins on the Standings idle screen should match Wins at https://www.mlb.com/standings

title: Losses
custom_preconds: Given the user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Standings idle screen
custom_expected:
Then the user will see updated Loses (L) for each club

Losses on the Standings idle screen should match losses at https://www.mlb.com/standings

title: Win Percentage
custom_preconds: Given the user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Standings idle screen
custom_expected:
Then the user will see updated Win Percentage (PCT) for each club

Win Percentages on the Standings idle screen should match win percentages at https://www.mlb.com/standings

title: Games Behind (GB)
custom_preconds: Given the user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Standings idle screen
custom_expected:
Then the user will see updated Games Behind (GB) for each club
and the number will support one decimal point (6.0)
and the division leader(s) will show a dash (-) instead of a percentage

Games Behind on the Standings idle screen should match GB at https://www.mlb.com/standings

title: Failsafe: API/Lookup Issue
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and the Standings API or lookup data is not running
custom_expected:
Then the user will not see the Standings page
and the other screens will rotate

title: Design
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When the user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a configurable background image
and see the MLB logo in the upper left corner
and see the title of the screen (TODAY'S GAMES)
and see the instructional text just below the title (Ready to cast from your phone, laptop or tablet.)
and see the game cells for each game

Number of games for today should match the list of games for today at http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/schedule/index.jsp#date=05/23/2019 (link will take you to today's date by default OR you can edit the date field)

Team logos are here: http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/team-logos/html5/65x65/{teamId}.png
where {teamId} is replaced with Team ID from this table: https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=25799264

MLB logos are available via the 'MLB.tv logos' link here: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/QAspace/Test+Engineering+-+Devices

There are 6 background images that change with the idle screens every 30 seconds; the background images are located here:
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-01.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-02.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-03.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-04.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-05.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-06.jpg

title: 15 games
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and 15 games on the MLB schedule
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a 5x3 grid:
5 game cells wide
3 game cells tall

title: > 15 games
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and more than 15 games on the MLB schedule
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a 5x4 grid:
5 game cells wide
4 game cells tall
and even spacing between game cells

title: 0 games
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and 0 games on the MLB schedule (Home Run Derby (HRD), offseason, two days after All Star Game (ASG))
custom_expected:
Then the user will not see the Schedule idle screen
and the other screens will rotate as normal

title: Sort
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and views the game cells
custom_expected: Then the user will see the games sorted by start time

custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and views the game cell for a game in preview
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the away team logo and record on the left
and the home team logo and record on the right
and the away team info and the home team info will be separated by a @
and  the local time of the game will be displayed under the @

title: Live
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and views the game cell for a game in progress
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the away team logo and record on the left
and the home team logo and record on the right
and the away team info and home team info will be separated by a @
and LIVE text in blue will be displayed below the @

title: Final
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and views the game cell for a game in final
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the away team logo and record on the left
and the home team logo and record on the right
and the away team info and home team info will be separated by a @
and Final text in black will be displayed below the @

title: Postponed
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and views the game cell for a game in postponed state
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the away team logo and record on the left
and the home team logo and record on the right
and the away team info and home team info will be separated by a @
and PPD text in blue will be displayed below the @

title: Start Time: TBD
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and views the game cell for a game with a TBD time (3:33am is the time retrieved from the back-end, and indicates game time is TBD)
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the away team logo and record on the left
and the home team logo and record on the right
and the away team info and home team info will be separated by a @
and TBD in black text will be displayed below the @

title: Doubleheader - Back to Back
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and views the game cells for a back to back doubleheader

Game 1 with a start time or TBD
Game 2 with TBD
custom_expected:
Then the user will see two game cells
and the away team logo and record on the left
and the home team logo and record on the right
and away team info and home team info will be separated by a @
and the start time (or TBD) in black text will be displayed for the first game
and a start time of TBD in black text for the second game

Note: the 1st game will appear in time order, with the 2nd game following; if the 1st game is at the end of the row, the 2nd game will be displayed in the next row in the first position..

title: Doubleheader - Day/Night
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and views the game cell for a day/night doubleheader

Game 1 w/ a Time
Game 2 w/ a Time
custom_expected:
Then the user will see two game cells
and the away team logo and record on the left
and the home team logo and record on the right
and the away info and home info separated by a @
and see local time for the first game
and see local time for the second game
and sorted by time order

title: All Star Game
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and views the All Star Game
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the away league logo and record on the left
and the home league logo and record on the right
and the away league info and home league info will be separated by @
and the start time will appear below the @

Note: the Home team and Away team logos will be the AL and NL logos (see attached ASG.png)

title: Non MLB Team
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and is on the Schedule idle screen
and views the game cell for a game w/ a non MLB team (Spring Training exhibition game involving college teams or minor league teams)
custom_expected: Then the user will see the default logo (http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/team-logos/html5/65x65/default.png) for the non-MLB team

title: Failsafe: API/Lookup Issue
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is idle
and the Schedule API or lookup data is not running
custom_expected:
Then the user will not see the Schedules idle screen page
and the other idle screens will rotate as normal

custom_preconds:
Given a user is connected to a Chromecast device
and is idle

When the user views a idle screen
and then after 30 seconds
custom_expected:
Then the idle screen transitions from one to another, the background images will also update

http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-01.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-02.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-03.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-04.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-05.jpg
http://cd-images.mlbstatic.com/google/chromecast/receiver-bg-06.jpg

title: VOD
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps: When a user casts a VOD from a sender app
custom_expected: Then the VOD will cast

title: MLB - Live
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps: When a user casts a live MLB feed from a sender app
custom_expected: Then the live MLB feed will cast

title: MLB - Archive
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps: When a user casts a archive MLB feed from a sender app
custom_expected: Then the archive MLB feed will cast

title: Play
custom_preconds:
Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
and the casting content has been paused
custom_steps: When a user taps on the Play button (on the sender)
custom_expected:
Then content will play
and the progress bar will fade away

title: Pause
custom_preconds:
Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
and is casting content
custom_steps: When a user  taps on the Pause button
custom_expected:
Then content will pause
and the user will see the progress bar on the receiver app
and the progress bar will show the content is paused

title: Closed Captioning
custom_preconds: Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
custom_steps:
When a user is casting content from a sender app
and taps on the CC button
custom_expected:
Then the closed captioning will appear on the screen
and the user can toggle CC off and on

title: Closed Captioning and Natural Sound (Android ONLY)
custom_preconds:
Given a user is connected to a Chromecast
And has found content with Closed Captioning enabled
custom_steps:
When a user is casting content from a sender app
and taps on the CC button
and selects Audio/Natural Sound
custom_expected:
Then the closed captioning will appear on the screen
and the user can toggle CC off and on
and the stream plays as expected

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays -> Happy path
custom_preconds:
1. User should install latest At Bat store build (use a mix of iOS and Android devices)
2. User should Login with a valid account
3. Ensure that there are 7 devices logged in with the same account.
4. Need up to 7 Chromecasts for this test (should use at leat 2 or 3)
custom_steps:
1. User launches the At Bat app
2. User navs to TV EPG via TV icon
3. Connect to a Chromecast
4. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
5. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 6 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
6. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device
custom_expected: Then the user should see the concurrency error message on the 7th device

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify if the network disrupted then the other device should play the asset.
custom_preconds:
1. User should install latest At Bat store build on a mix of iOS and Android devices
2. User should Login with a valid account
3. Ensure that there are 7 devices logged in with the same account
4. Need up to 7 Chromecasts (use at least 2 or 3 for this test)
custom_steps:
1. User launches the At Bat app
2. User navs to TV EPG via TV icon
3. Connect to an unused Chromecast
4. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
5. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 6 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
1. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
1. Disconnect the WIFI in one of the devices playing asset.
custom_expected: If the user's 7th device is getting the concurrency error message when playing on 6 other devices and if one of the playing device's network is disrupted, THEN the device having the error message should be able to play the stream.

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays after relaunching the App
custom_preconds:
User should install latest At Bat store build on a mix of iOS and Android devices
User should Login with a valid account
Ensure that there are 7 devices logged in with the same account
Need up to 7 Chromecasts (use 2 or 3 minimum)
custom_steps:
1. User launches the At Bat aoo
2. User navs to TV EPG via TV icon
3. Connect to an unused Chromecast
4. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
5. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 6 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
Exit stream on 7th device (that had seen the concurrency error).
Wait a little over 2 minutes. Re-launch stream on 7th device.
custom_expected: WHEN the user Re-launches stream on 7th device, then user should see the concurrency error message again.

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays for the 7th and 8th device
custom_preconds:
1. User should install latest At Bat store build on a mix of iOS and Android devices
2. User should Login with a valid account
3. Ensure that there are 8 devices logged in with the same account.
4. Need up to 8 Chromecasts (use at least2 or 3)
custom_steps:
1. User launches At Bat app
2. User navs to TV EPG via TV icon
3. Connect to an unused Chromecast
4. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
5. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 6 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
5. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
6. Exit stream on 7th device (that had seen the concurrency error).
7. Activate/Launch the app in the 8th device and play the asset.
custom_expected: WHEN the user launches the stream on 8th device, then user should see the concurrency error message.

title: Authenticated -> Concurrency -> Verify whether the Concurrency error message displays for the 8th device
custom_preconds:
1. User should install latest At Bat app from store build on a mix of iOS and Android devices
2. User should Login with a valid account
3. Ensure that there are 8 devices logged in with the same account.
4. Need up to 8 Chromecasts (use 2 or 3 minimum)
custom_steps:
1. User launches the At Bat app
2. User navs to TV EPG via TV icon
3. Connect to an unused Chromecast
4. Select any VOD/Live and play the asset.
5. Kick off the stream on max number of devices, in this case 6 (No need to wait a period of time between these launches.)
5. Wait a little over 2 minutes, then kick off the stream on the next device. This device should display the concurrency error.
6. Activate/Launch the app on the 8th device and play the asset.
custom_expected: WHEN the user launches the stream on 8th device, then user should still see the concurrency error message on the 8th device.
